<br/>

We are organized in 3 work groups, each with its own focus and projects:

-   The [Experimental Rocketry](/projects.html#category=Experimental%20Rocketry) group develops rockets to launch payloads, test their subsystems and compete in rocketry competitions. These rockets have so far been built using COTS solid-propellant engines. A hybrid engine and a test environment are currently in development.

-   The [Science and Experiments](/projects.html#category=Science%20and%20Experiments) group develops and operates science experiments and payloads. Furthermore, it develops, designs and builds satellite components and systems.

-   In the [Robotics](/projects.html#category=Robotics) group, we focus on planetary exploration of the moon and mars. This includes, for example, building rovers or developing in situ resource utilization technologies like solar sintering.

## How to reach out to us

Regardless of your academic background, we would like to welcome you to our team! If you are interested, contact us via [mail](mailto://info@bears-space.de) or on [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/bears.space/). You can also join us directly in our weekly meeting **Tuesdays** at **6 pm** in the **F11** at the [**ILR**](https://maps.app.goo.gl/sixUKMx4wxruqQFr8):
